definition: to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander

sentences.english: The workers torn down the old house and built a new one in its place.
sentences.chinese: 工人們拆毀舊屋，並在原址上另蓋新屋。

sentences.english: The Three Gorges Dam is there, and is impossible to tear down.
sentences.chinese: 三峽大壩就在那裏，並且不可能拆毀。

sentences.english: We strolled through the old town and watched a very old house being demolished.
sentences.chinese: 我們在老城閒逛，看到了被拆毀的一座很古老的房子。

sentences.english: The whole Babylonian army, under the commander of the imperial guard, broke down the walls around Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 跟從護衛長迦勒底的全軍就拆毀耶路撒冷四圍的城牆。

sentences.english: Old villages surrounded by the expanding city are being demolished.
sentences.chinese: 被擴展中的北京城所包圍的老村莊正被拆毀。

sentences.english: The old cinema was torn down and replaced by a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 老電影院被拆毀，取而代之的是一個飯店。

sentences.english: The Lord tears down the proud man's house but he keeps the widow's boundaries intact.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華必拆毀驕傲人的家，卻要立定寡婦的地界。

sentences.english: The hardcore for the slab consists of demolition rubble from the previous building on the site.
sentences.chinese: 板層的核心是以前建築拆毀後的碎石塊。

sentences.english: After that the council came demolishing everything.
sentences.chinese: 那之後理事會就來了，拆毀所有東西。

sentences.english: The brisk brave brigade broke the brick bridge across the broad bloody river.
sentences.chinese: 這支士氣旺盛的勁旅拆毀了血水染紅的大河上的磚橋。

sentences.english: The city will tear down these buildings to make room for the new highway .
sentences.chinese: 市政當局要拆毀這些建築物以讓出地方修築新公路。

sentences.english: They have torn off the old building.
sentences.chinese: 他們已拆毀了那幢舊建築。

sentences.english: And he shall set engines of war against thy walls, and with his axes he shall break down thy towers.
sentences.chinese: 他必安設撞城錘攻破你的牆垣，用鐵器拆毀你的城樓。

sentences.english: He must die, because he has broken down Baal's altar and cut down the Asherah pole beside it.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他拆毀了巴力的壇，砍下壇旁的木偶。

sentences.english: But it came, it was threatened. They came very close to that
sentences.chinese: 但它面臨過危機。他們差點就把它拆毀了，

definition: to sacrifice oneself in a just cause/a victim of a disaster
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
Great stone bridge or Dashiqiao county level city in Yingkou 營口|营口, Liaoning
to level/to raze to the ground
Binyang county in Nanning 南寧|南宁[Nan2 ning2], Guangxi
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
to burn down/to destroy with fire
